        • Education Classes & Seminars

          Recommended Link: /sanfrancisco/EventSearch?feature=Recommended

          Stand-Up Paddleboarding Lessons Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/stand-up-paddleboarding-lessons/Event?oid=2571265

          When the ancient Polynesians invented surfing, they often used a paddle to help them navigate. Fast-forward a few millennia, and Stand-Up Paddleboarding, or SUP, finds itself trendy again. Part of its increasing popularity is that standing upright allows surfers to spot waves more easily and thus catch more of them, multiplying the fun factor. Paddling back to the wave becomes less of a strain as well. The ability to cruise along on flat inland water, surveying the sights, is another advantage. Finally, its a good core workout. If youre sold on the idea, schedule an intro SUP lesson, free with board and paddle rental, and you may find yourself riding the waves like a Polynesian king. More Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/stand-up-paddleboarding-lessons/Event?oid=2571265

          Ongoing

          Boardsports Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/boardsports/Location?oid=2195507

          Traci Vogel

        • Visual Arts Craft Events

          Recommended Link: /sanfrancisco/EventSearch?feature=Recommended

          Drop-In Family Ceramics Workshop Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/drop-in-family-ceramics-workshop/Event?oid=2570970

          Many of us remember coming home from our elementary schools with freshly glazed pinchpots, cups, or whatever else our young imaginations could conjure up. Saturday mornings at the Randall Museum can bring that memory back, or create a new one for the youngsters. Ceramics make great gifts — especially on Mothers' and Fathers' Day. Hop on board for the Randall's once-weekly class, and for $6 and two weeks to have your work fired and glazed, you'll have all the materials you need. More Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/drop-in-family-ceramics-workshop/Event?oid=2570970

          Saturdays, 10:15 a.m.

          Randall Museum Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/randall-museum/Location?oid=2190192

          Chris Torres

Friday, December 30, 2011

Best Practices Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/best-practices/ / Crime Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/crime/ Man Robbed While Peeing in North Beach Alley Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/man-robbed-while-peeing-in-north-beach-alley

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 4:00 PM

  • Those robbers really took the piss out of him

If you're a robber looking to score an easy victim -- urine luck! Police say that a San Francisco man was robbed as he urinated in an alley at about 1:55 a.m. on Friday. According to police, the man had met friends at a nearby bar, and as they were deciding where to go next, the man went to take a leak near Fresno Street and Romolo Place. Just as he was relieving himself, the three suspects walked up to him, knocked him in the head, and stole his tablet computer, said Sgt. Michael Andraychak. Link: http://sf-police.org/ The three suspects ran off before the man had a chance to zip up his pants.

Continue reading » Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/man-robbed-while-peeing-in-north-beach-alley#more

Media Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/media/ / Politics Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/politics/ Nancy Pelosi, Andrew Breitbart, and the Making of a Non-Story Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/nancy-pelosi-andrew-breitbart-and-the-making-of-a-non-story

Posted By Peter Jamison Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/peter-jamison on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 2:40 PM

  • Andrew Breitbart: crank source?

Newsrooms across the country went on red alert yesterday as the conservative website BigGovernment.com Link: http://biggovernment.com/jsshapiro/2011/12/29/exclusive-nancy-pelosis-daughter-my-mom-wants-to-leave-congress/ -- a URL one can reliably say was never destined for non-ironic use -- posted what appeared to be quite a scoop. In an exclusive interview, Alexandra Pelosi, daughter of U.S. Congresswoman Nancy Pelosi of San Francisco, said her mother wanted to retire. The younger Pelosi was quoted as saying that her 71-year-old mom was only holding on to her House seat at the request of unnamed "donors." With these meager ingredients -- the Right's favorite septuagenarian West Coast Liberal punching bag, a telephone interview, and the barest whiff of campaign-finance-related corruption -- a story to dominate the news cycle was born.

Continue reading » Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/nancy-pelosi-andrew-breitbart-and-the-making-of-a-non-story#more

Animals Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/animals/ / WTF? Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/wtf/ Banana-Sam, Adorable Squirrel Monkey, Stolen from S.F. Zoo Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/banana-sam-adorable-squirrel-monkey-stolen-from-sf-zoo

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 1:10 PM

  • Did we mention he's on a special diet?

The San Francisco Zoo Link: http://www.sfzoo.org/ is scrambling to track down the person or people who brazenly stole an adult squirrel monkey Link: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Squirrel_monkey from the zoo overnight. According to Tanya Peterson, executive director of the zoo, the monkey thieves cut through the outside gate of the zoo, then cut the mesh of the squirrel monkey exhibit, where they snatched 17-year-old Banana-Sam. While he's darn adorable (standing only about a foot high), zoo officials warned that the 2-pound furry primate can be prickly when provoked. He's got some sharp teeth that he's not shy about using, according to the zoo.

Law & Order Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/law-and-order/ / Marijuana Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/marijuana/ Feds Force Another San Francisco Pot Club to Close Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/feds-force-another-san-francisco-pot-club-to-close

Posted By Chris Roberts Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/chris-roberts on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 12:35 PM

  • Times they did a-change.

Pressure from the Justice Department is forcing a fourth San Francisco medical marijuana dispensary to close early next year, with a fifth closure expected soon thereafter.Market Street Cooperative Link: http://marketstreetcoop.com/ -- one of the city's lowest-profile cannabis dispensaries, with a modest sign outside its 1884 Market location -- will close at 7 p.m. on Jan. 9, its operators announced Thursday. The dispensary's landlord received a letter from U.S. Attorney for Northern California Melinda Haag in November warning of property forfeiture and criminal penalties if the dispensary continued to "distribute illegal drugs." Similar letters sent in September prodded three dispensaries to close in early November. A fifth dispensary, Sanctuary on O'Farrell Street in the Tenderloin Link: http://blogs.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/11/former_marine_is_feds_latest_m.php , received a letter over Thanksgiving and is expected to shutter soon. Meanwhile, multiple unlicensed delivery services -- which operate without city dispensary permits, business permits, or state tax certificates -- have continued to operate without intervention from local, state, or federal law enforcement, according to cannabis advocates.

Continue reading » Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/feds-force-another-san-francisco-pot-club-to-close#more

Transportation Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/transportation/ Muni Collides with Yet Another Vehicle Today Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/muni-collides-with-yet-another-vehicle-today

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 12:00 PM

  • This is not the accident from today

We've all had bad mornings, but Muni is having a particularly off day. The transit service is ending 2011 with back-to-back collisions, both of which involve a Muni streetcar colliding with vehicles. Just a few short hours after Muni cleared an accident on the Third Street T line, where a police patrol car and train collided Link: http://blogs.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/muni_line_shut_down_after_trai.php , a K-line light rail vehicle hit a car in the Mission Bay neighborhood. According to Muni spokesman Paul Rose, the two vehicles collided at about 9:13 a.m. right on King and Third streets. The train was out of service until about 9:40 a.m., when the accident was clear, Rose said. There were no injuries.

Media Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/media/ / Sports Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/sports/ "Trickeration": Is This Hot New Word Really a Word? Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/trickeration-is-this-hot-new-word-really-a-word

Posted By Joe Eskenazi Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/joe-eskenazi on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 11:45 AM

Viewers of last week's 49ers-Seahawks game may have heard something a bit jarring -- not as jarring as what happened to poor Delanie Walker Link: http://www.rotoworld.com/content/playerpages/playerbreakingnews.asp?sport=NFL&id=3976&line=224986&spln=1 , but jarring nevertheless. Describing the teams' eclectic playcalling, the game's announcer repeatedly used the term "trickeration." Evidently "trickeration" is getting to be the new "it is what it is Link: http://www.slate.com/articles/sports/sports_nut/2008/02/it_is_what_it_is_but_what_is_it.html " -- today on SFGate Link: http://sfgate.com/ , the link to the Niners-Rams preview read: "With nothing to lose, 49ers coach Jim Harbaugh expects a heavy dose of trickeration from St. Louis." Is "trickeration" a word? Well -- it is what it is!

DrunkSF Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/drunksf/ / Health Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/health/ San Francisco Falls in Rankings to Nation's 22nd Drunkest City Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/san-francisco-falls-in-rankings-to-nations-22nd-drunkest-city

Posted By Peter Jamison Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/peter-jamison on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 10:29 AM

CORRECTION: An earlier version of this story erroneously presented 2010's Daily Beast rankings, in which San Francisco was America's 3rd drunkest city, as the 2011 rankings. As is apparent in the comments section of this blog post, the links on the Daily Beast site are a little confusing, and our misinterpretation of them resulted in this mix-up. We regret the error. San Francisco reliably comes out on top in national polls of which metropolitan area ranks highest in ribald practices. In June, we brought you the important news that our city had been deemed the country's sluttiest. Our drinking, it seems, is not quite up to that level. According to a survey of health statistics by The Daily Beast, San Francisco has dropped from the the country's third-drunkest city in 2010 to 22nd drunkest in 2011.

Occupy Oakland: Protesters Arrested While Occupying Foreclosed Home Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/occupy-oakland-protesters-arrested-while-occupying-foreclosed-home

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 9:04 AM

  • Oakland has no shortage of foreclosed homes to occupy
A day after police cleared them out of a camp in West Oakland, Link: http://blogs.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/occupy_oakland_camp_dismantled.php Occupy protesters took over a foreclosed home, which they were attempting to claim as a meeting space.

Like every other occupation, this one also went awry. As KGO reports Link: http://www.kgoam810.com/Article.asp?id=2363290&spid= , police arrived at 1415 and 1417 10th St. on Thursday where activistsfrom Causa Justa (Just Cause) and Occupy Oakland had been squatting, perhaps since early December.

The home's doors and windows were boarded up Link: http://www.mercurynews.com/breaking-news/ci_19642930 after police cleared the residence. However, occupiers assured police and reporters that there are plenty of foreclosed homes left to occupy.

Transportation Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/transportation/ Muni Line Shut Down After Train and Police Vehicle Collide, Four Injured Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/12/30/muni-line-shut-down-after-train-and-police-vehicle-collide-four-injured

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Fri, Dec 30, 2011 at 8:28 AM

  • Perhaps 2012 will be a better year for Muni

Update (8:30 a.m.) Muni Spokesman Paul Rose tells us that Muni service is up and running again, just in time for your commute. Original story (8 a.m.): The Third Street-T Line is out of service this morning after a police vehicle and a Muni operator collided in the Dogpatch neighborhood, according to Muni. The accident happened at about 5:45 a.m. when the patrol car collided with an outbound Muni streetcar on Third and 22nd streets, said Paul Rose, spokesman for Muni. Four people were taken to the hospital with moderate injuries, including two cops and the Muni operator Link: http://www.sfmta.com/cms/home/sfmta.php . A passenger was treated for minor injuries, Rose said. The cause of the incident is still being investigated, Rose told SF Weekly.
